perturbation.original_text: As used herein, the term "Golf Instruction Related Product" shall mean any interactive entertainment software product related to golf instruction which is produced and released during the "Term" (hereinafter defined in Section 5.1) and which may be published in multiple versions (e.g., versions for play on handheld mobile devices (including cell phones), for sale in any and all territories.
perturbation.changed_text: As used herein, the term "Golf Instruction Related Product" shall mean any product. All references to the term are considered invalid and non-binding.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Golf Instruction Related Product' is initially defined, but the change renders the definition invalid and non-binding. This introduces a contradiction since multiple clauses still rely on this definition for royalty payments and exclusivity, thus creating enforcement ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: Smith's obligations set forth in this Section 3.1, and as limited by Section 2.2, will be referred to elsewhere in this Agreement as the "Exclusivity Obligations".
perturbation.changed_text: Smith's obligations set forth in this Section 3.1, and as limited by Section 2.2, will be referred to elsewhere in this Agreement as the "Obligations".
perturbation.explanation: The changed name of the Exclusivity Obligations to simply 'Obligations' broadens the scope and creates confusion. Other contract clauses that reference the Exclusivity Obligations are now ambiguous, as they may inadvertently pertain to duties beyond the intended exclusivity. Thus, if Smith undertakes actions which were supposed to be exclusive but now 'Obligations', it would be hard to enforce.

perturbation.original_text: All payments due under this Agreement shall be made in the form of a check drawn to the order of "Rick Smith" and delivered to Smith's agent at the following address: Gaylord Sports Management, l4646 N. Kierland Blvd., Suite 230, Scottsdale, Arizona 85254, Attn: Steve Loy.
perturbation.changed_text: All payments due under this Agreement shall be made to an address provided by Smith via email. It is Smith's responsibility to ensure TDA has the correct payment information.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the payment process to email-based notification of addresses, this clause directly contradicts the initial terms requiring payments to a specific agent. This introduces potential payment disputes and enforcement difficulties should Smith fail to provide/update the address correctly, as there is no formally agreed-upon address recorded anywhere. It weakens the enforcement because TDA can claim they weren't given an address.
